Incident.Summary: Commercial General Contractor had a check intercepted and modified for a loss of $66,229.68.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On October 24, 2023, I was forwarded a case for investigation for a reported fraud/ theft involving Trident Builders. According to the initial complaint/email, Brendan McCluskey from Trident Builders reached out to report the fraud.McCluskeys email describes Trident Builders as a commercial general contractor that does 50% federal work. One of the companys projects is with the DoD and is bonded by a surety company based in Florida which issues funds to subcontractors at the direction of Trident Builders. The Escrow company, Great Horn Financial Services, issued a check on September 13, 2023 (check number 1709) for $29.68 that was meant to go to Baltimore Door Frame and was sent through the mail. That company never received the check and when Trident Builders reviewed their financial report, they observed that the check had been modified and made payable to Wayne Engram (129 Eagle Head Drive, Fort Washington, MD 20744) for a total amount of $66,229.68. That check was successfully deposited on September 19, 2023. Trident initially reported the theft to the U.S. Secret Service who instructed them to contact the Maryland State Police so we could coordinate efforts. On October 24, 2023, I sent an email to Mr.McCluskey and requested the contact information for the investigator from the Secret Service. Mr.McCluskey connected me with Special Agent C. Forbes of the Secret Service and I would soon make contact with him to inquire what he has done so far. According to S.A Forbes, Mr.McCluskey reported the above information to him as well. Additionally,McCluskey notified him on October 23, 2023, that another check was deposited on October 17, 2023, using the same altered check, but was modified to be made payable to Bernard Thomas (2947 Reed Street, Fort Wayne, IN 46806). S.A Forbes instructedMcCluskey to notify PNC bank of the modified checks, close that account, complete an IC3 report, and notify The Maryland State Police. S.A. Forbes advised that he has reached out to PNC Bank in an effort to obtain additional information for the account to which the checks were deposited. As of this date (November 22) S.A. Forbes has not received any additional information. I then conducted a query ofWayne Engram 129 Eagle Head Drive, Fort Washington, MD 20744 through numerous law enforcement and open sourced websites. That research revealed the address owner to be Wayne William Engram (Male, DOB: 03/02/1962). It also showed that Engram is employed by WE Investigations Inc which uses the same address. The company website https://www.weinvestigations.com/ indicates that they are a process server and private investigations company in Maryland, Virginia and Washington DC. Case Remains Open
